div.p: Grace and innocence of life from the Lord! That craftsman from Cremona came to me bearing letters from Vergerio; I also entrusted to him the packet I had eight days ago. He is hastening to Geneva to live there by his craft and to be secure from severe persecution. He will undoubtedly inform you about Italian affairs.

I would write more, but the courier is in too much of a hurry; in eight days, if I find a suitable courier, I will write about everything. Philippus Gallicius has become a colleague of our church, a learned man and patient in labor; he will often write to you in our name. Farewell. From Chur, 22nd of February, 1551.
Be so kind as to greet Franz with his family in my name.
To the most honorable man, Master Heinrich Bullinger, his brother and esteemed lord.
